title: Ticket #6643: condor_q should  use -wide mode when writing to a pipe or file
description: condor_q currently truncates it's output to fit the width of the display (except -long and -af which do not). When the output is a pipe or file, the width of the display is not known, so it truncates to 80 columns. Instead, it should switch to wide mode when writing to a pipe or file, which would not truncate the output at all.
